class.name: Shaman
classFeatures: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Shaman|Shaman|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman

default: (a) a {@item shield|phb} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|type=simple weapon=sand|category=basic}
(a) a {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|phb} or {@item druidic focus|phb}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Shaman
entries: Nature is a powerful force containing a myriad of mysterious magics. Shamans have the ability - learned, intuited, or innate - to act as a conduit for that natural magic.
Shamans channel ancient rites in the form of runes, summon elemental spirits, and evoke powerful elemental magic to manipulate their enemies and allies alike.

entries.name: Creating a Shaman
entries: To create a Shaman, consult the subsections which give you hit points, proficiencies, and starting equipment. Then look at the Shaman table to see which features you get at each level. The descriptions of those features appear below.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Shaman quickly with these suggestions: First, put your highest ability score in Wisdom, followed by Constitution or Dexterity; second, choose the Outlander background; third, choose the {@spell Produce Flame|phb} and {@spell Dancing Lights|phb} cantrips, along with the 1st-level {@spell Ice Knife|xge} and {@spell Thunderwave|phb} spells.

entries.name: Multiclassing and the Shaman
entries: If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player's Handbook, here's what you need to know if you choose artificer as one of your classes.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: As a multiclass character, you must have at least a Wisdom score of 13 to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a Shaman.

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: If Shaman isn't your initial class, here are the proficiencies you gain when you take your first level as a Shaman: light armor and simple weapons.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: To determine your available spell slots, you include all of your Shaman levels.

classFeature.name: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Shaman
entries: While Shamans channel nature's magic in a similar mystical manner to druids, it is also possible to learn this power through study, or through force of will in dedication to nature.
If this is the case for your Shaman, you may prefer to use Intelligence or Charisma instead of Wisdom for your shaman features. If you do so, make the following changes:

items: Wherever you would use Wisdom for your shaman features or specialism features, such as your Spellcasting or Rune features, you instead use your chosen ability.
If you choose Intelligence, you replace Charisma as a saving throw proficiency given by this class with Intelligence.
A multiclassed character would require a 13 in the chosen ability (instead of Wisdom) to take a level in this class, or take a level in another if Shaman is your first class.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin
entries: At 1st level, you determine the origin of your shaman abilities. This could be the source that they are drawn from, where your Shaman grew up or learned their magic, or the specific location they first unlocked their magical gifts.
This origin grants you features at 1st level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Primordial Runes
entries: Your access to the primal forces of the world has granted you access to Primordial Runes, fragments of primal spirits which can enhance your own power, grant you new abilities or allow you to conjure totems which grant benefits within an area.

At 2nd level, you gain 2 Primordial Runes of your choice. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=PRU} page. When you gain certain Shaman levels, you gain additional runes of your choice, as shown in the Runes column of the Shaman table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the runes you know and replace it with another that you could learn at that level.
If a rune has prerequisites, you must meet them to channel that rune. You can channel a rune at the same time you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.
If you lose the prerequisite for a rune, for example you change your elemental affinity, you may replace it with another rune for which you meet the prerequisite.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: Your attunement to nature grants you an affinity with a specific element. Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Affinity with Flame
entries: Your chosen element is fire. You gain the {@spell Firebolt|phb} or {@spell Green-Flame Blade|tce} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Growing Heat} feature below.

entries.name: Growing Heat
entries: Whenever you deal fire damage to a creature, they take additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus whenever you deal fire damage to them before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Affinity with Frost
entries: Your chosen element is cold. You gain the {@spell Ray of Frost|phb} or {@spell Frostbite|xge} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Biting cold} feature below.

entries.name: Biting Cold
entries: Once per round, when you deal cold damage to a creature, that creature suffers a penalty equal to your proficiency bonus to the next attack roll or ability check that it makes.

entries.name: Affinity with Lightning
entries: Your chosen element is lightning. You gain the {@spell Crackling Bolt|J:General} or {@spell Shocking Grasp|phb} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Arc Lightning} feature below.

entries.name: Arc Lightning
entries: Once per round, when you deal lightning damage to a creature, you can arc lightning from one target to another. Up to two different creatures of your choice within 15 feet of the original target take Lightning damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Affinity with Thunder
entries: Your chosen element is thunder. You gain the {@spell Thunderclap|xge} or {@spell Booming Blade|tce} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Thundercrack} feature below.

entries.name: Thundercrack
entries: Once per turn, when you deal Thunder damage to a creature, you may move it five feet in a direction of your choice, provided it is large or smaller. Additionally, whenever you deal thunder damage to an object, you maximise the value of the dice instead of rolling damage against that object.

entries.name: Affinity with Acid
entries: Your chosen element is acid. You gain the {@spell Acid Splash|phb} or {@spell Primal Savagery|xge} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Persistent Corrosion} feature below.

entries.name: Persistent Corrosion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature, you can cause the acid to linger on them. At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes acid damage equal to your proficiency bonus. The acid lasts until a creature uses its action to remove it, or you use this feature again on a different target.
You can change your elemental affinity whenever you gain a level in this class.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: You become resistant to the damage type of your chosen elemental affinity.

classFeature.name: Primordial Knowledge
entries: Your strong connection to nature allows you access to ancient knowledge and abilities:
You gain a bonus to {@skill arcana} and {@skill nature} checks equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
You learn the {@spell Skill Empowerment|xge} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot. It does not count against the number of Shaman spells you know.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: You become immune to the damage type of your chosen elemental affinity.

classFeature.name: Overload
entries: When you cast a Shaman spell, you can deal the maximum possible damage instead of rolling on the turn that you cast it.
Upon doing so, you take force damage equal to your Shaman level plus the level of the spell cast, which cannot be reduced in any way, and you cannot cast spells until after your next turn.
After you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Conduit
entries: You may add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage you deal with any cantrip that deals fire, cold, thunder, lightning, or acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit's Intuition
entries: You learn the {@spell Guidance|phb} cantrip. It has a duration of ten minutes when you cast it.

optionalfeature.name: Moon's Spirit
entries: You do not need to sleep and cannot be forced to by any means. You can gain a long rest by doing 8 hours of light activity insteaed of sleeping.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Warrior
entries: You learn the {@spell Shillelagh} cantrip, and when you cast it it lasts for ten minutes and can be applied to any weapon with which you are proficient.

optionalfeature.name: Roots of the Tree
entries: You may add your proficiency bonus to saving throws made to maintain your {@status concentration} on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Understanding
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals} at will and without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Darkseer
entries: You gain darkvision out to 120 feet, or increase your existing darkvision by 120 feet. Your darkvision makes darkness appear as bright light to you, instead of dim.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Arcana
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|phb}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good}, and {@spell Detect Poison and Disease} once per long rest each, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Lightfeet
entries: You learn the {@spell Longstrider|phb} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Jungle's Bounty
entries: You can cast the {@spell Goodberry|phb} spell once per long rest. When you cast the spell in this way, you create an additional number of berries equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} and {@skill Medicine} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Far Sight
entries: As part of an hour-long ritual, you look into the future, sensing a power you might require. You can then swap one spell that you know for another on the Shaman spell list. You may do this only once each {@dice 2d4} days.
{@note The spell you can learn follows normal rules. For example, a 6th level Shaman could learn a 3rd level spell or lower, even if they had 4th level spell slots.}

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Manipulation
entries: You can change the damage type of a spell you cast to the damage type of your Elemental Affinity.

optionalfeature.name: Home at Sea
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a swimming speed, this increases it by 10 feet instead.
You also learn the {@spell Water Breathing|phb} spell, which doesn't count against your known Shaman spells.

optionalfeature.name: Home in the Trees
entries: You gain a climbing speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a climbing speed, this increases it by 10 feet instead.
You learn the {@spell Spider Climbing} spell and cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Heart
entries: You learn the {@spell Summon Fey|tce} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Thorns
entries: Upon taking damage from a creature you can see, or one that is within 5 feet of you, you can spend a reaction to deal {@dice 1d6} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
This damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at 11th level.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Elemental Superiority
entries: When you deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity, you ignore resistance to damage of that type.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Teachings
entries: You learn the {@spell Polymorph} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aversion
entries: You learn the {@spell Elemental Bane|xge} spell. Once per long rest, when you cast this spell, you can forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on it by reducing its duration to two turns.

optionalfeature.name: Keeper of the Grove
entries: Once per short rest, you can attempt to allow nature to siphon a creature's magic for a turn.
The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@dice 3d12} radiant damage and becomes {@condition silenced|S: Conditions} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Small Friends
entries: You learn the {@spell Insect Plague} spell. You can communicate with insects freely.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Walker
entries: You learn the {@spell Transport Via Plants|phb} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Roots
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast the Grasping vine spell. When you do so, you can either cast the spell as a bonus action, or forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Command of Air
entries: You can cast the {@spell Fly|phb} spell at will.

optionalfeature.name: Earthly Intuition
entries: You gain Tremorsense to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Will
entries: If you cast a spell and miss all of its attack roll(s), or all targets pass their saving throws to resist its effect, you can cast a cantrip as a bonus action instead of an action. You may do this once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Searing Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Searing Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which causes creatures to {@condition burning|S: Conditions|burn} on entering the area, or take {@damage 1d4} fire damage if they are already burning.

optionalfeature.name: Roaring Flames
entries: The size of your spells that deal fire damage, if they specify an area, increase by 5 feet when you cast them. If a spell specifies multiple dimensions, such as {@spell Wall of Fire|phb}, you one to increases.

optionalfeature.name: Compound Burns
entries: Your {@b Growing Heat} feature improves. A creature now takes additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus any time they take fire damage, instead of only when you deal it. The effect's duration is still only increased by you.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Glacial Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which, to creatures you choose, makes the area surrounding it difficult terrain and prevents regaining of hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Block
entries: When you deal cold damage to one or more creatures, you can gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus for each creature you hit.

optionalfeature.name: Absolute Zero
entries: Your {@b Biting Cold} feature is enhanced. The penalty now applies to the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that the target makes. It also imposes disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Voltaic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Voltaic Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which prevents creatures of your choice within its area from taking reactions.

optionalfeature.name: Spasming Shocks
entries: Once per round, if you deal lightning damage to a creature by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can cause it to be {@condition staggered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Aftershock
entries: Your {@b Arc Lightning} feature improves. It can now affect up to four targets, and the range limitation of 15 feet is between targets affected by this feature, not the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Booming Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Booming Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which creates a shockwave that pushes creatures of your choosing away from the totem.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Thunderclap
entries: Once per turn, when you deal Thunder damage to a creature with a spell of at least 3rd level, it must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Reverberating Thunder
entries: Your {@b Thundercrack} feature improves. You are able to push creatures of any size, and the distance increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Caustic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Caustic Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which reduces the AC of creatures of your choice in its area by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Erosion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition sundered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Viscous Acid
entries: Your {@b Persistent Corrosion} feature improves. A creature suffering from the effect is {@condition Hampered|S: Conditions} and deals {@damage 1d4} less damage with weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Totem Summoning
entries: You gain the ability to conjure a Nature Spirit Totem. This tiny elemental creature applies an effect to an area within 15 feet of itself. If a totem deals damage, you are considered to have done that damage.

Summoning a totem requires an action, and the totem appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you, and lasts for one minute. Once summoned, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest or unless you expend a spell slot of first level or higher.

The totem requires your {@status concentration} (as if you were concentrating on a spell), however, you can summon additional totems using the same concentration. Whenever you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration, you choose one totem to disappear. If you use another effect which requires concentration such as a spell, they all disappear.
You know how to summon two totems from the list below. You can change your selection whenever you gain a level in this class.
{@creature Taunting Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Warding Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Warning Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Lifting Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Blessing Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Wrath of Air Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}

optionalfeature.name: Totemkeeper
entries: When expending a spell slot to summon a totem, you may summon two at once if the spell slot expended is of third level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Blast
entries: Your totems gain the ability to launch a blast of elemental magic. The blast uses your spell attack modifier, is fired from an active totem using your bonus action, and deals {@damage 1d8+PB} damage of a type matching your elemental affinity.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Might
entries: When you summon a totem, it gains temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Commander
entries: You have greater control over where your totems are summoned. You can summon them in the air, or attached to you or a willing creature.

A totem attached to a creature moves with it, but can still be targeted individually. If attached to a creature, you can expend a reaction to force the totem to be the new target of an attack that would otherwise hit the creature it is attached to.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Specialist
entries: You learn how to summon two more totems from the list in the {@optfeature Rune of Totem Summoning|S: Shaman}.
Furthermore, your totems become proficient in all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Enforcement Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Enforcement Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which grants creatures of your choice temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns and prevents them from being moved against their will.

optionalfeature.name: Manarage Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Manarage Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which grants the following benefit in its area:

Creatures within the area may cast one first-level spell without expending a spell slot, or use any feature which can be used more than once per short rest, without expending a use of that feature, but no more than once per turn.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Taunting Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Hostile creatures within this totem's area have disadvantage on any attack that doesn't target the totem.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast (Requires Totemic Blast Primordial Rune)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Warning Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Once per round, creatures within the area can gain a bonus to one saving throw they make. The bonus is equal to half your spellcasting ability modifier (rounded up).

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Warding Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

When a creature hostile to you attempts to enter the totem's area, it must make a {@savingThrow Wisdom} saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition Halted|S: Conditions} until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Lifting Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

When a friendly creature would enter this totem's area, it can spend an additional 5 feet of movement to be lifted by elemental winds and carried to the opposite side of the area. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.
A friendly creature that starts its turn within the area gains 10 feet of movement speed for that turn.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Blessing Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Once per round, creatures within the area can gain a bonus to one attack roll or ability check they make. The bonus is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

monster.name: Wrath of Air Nature Spirit Totem

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Wrath of Air Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

Once per round, any creature within the totem's area may add their spellcasting ability modifier to one damage roll from an attack or spell. If they do not have a spellcasting ability modifier, they use their Wisdom ability modifier.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Manarage Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures within this area may cast one first-level spell without expending a spell slot, or use any feature which can be used more than once per short rest, without expending a use of that feature.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Manarage Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures in the area that you choose gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of your turns. They cannot be moved agains their will.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Searing Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

Any creature which enters the area for the first time on a turn, or starts its turn there, becomes {@condition burning|S: Conditions}. If a creature is already {@condition burning|S: Conditions}, it takes {@dice 1d4} fire damage instead.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Glacial Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
The area is difficult terrain for creatures of your choice. Additionally, those creatures cannot regain hit points while in the area.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Voltaic Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Creatures of your choice within the area are unable to take reactions.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem

trait.name: Booming Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

At the start of your turns, the totem emits a shockwave. Each creature of your choice within the totem's area must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the totem.
